snippet: In the last year, the initial public offerings of once obscure security start-ups have outperformed the offerings from household names like Facebook and Zynga.
abstract: Initial public offerings of once obscure computer security start-ups in the last year have outperformed offerings from household names like Facebook and Zynga; big companies are expected to spend $32.8 billion on computer security in 2012, up 9 percent from 2011; rise of security start-ups is fueled by new technology, fear, and wealthy investors.

byline.original: By NICOLE PERLROTH and EVELYN M. RUSLI

lead_paragraph: In the last year, the initial public offerings of once obscure security start-ups have outperformed the offerings from household names like Facebook and Zynga.

headline.seo: Computer Security Start-Ups Catch Venture Capitalists’ Eyes
headline.main: Security Start-Ups Catch Fancy of Investors
headline.print_headline: Security Start-Ups Catch Fancy Of Investors
